GameObjects

Class Projectile

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObjects.GameObject
      • GameObjects.Projectile

  • public class Projectile
extends GameObject
    Projectile contain's code for the unique animating and movements of the shot. Projectiles only travel in the y direction and follow a wave - like path, unlike ships which move in all directions.
    Author:
    Mason Dumaine

      This constructor uses the super constructor to initialize the object's data members.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drawObject(java.awt.Graphics pen)
      The unique drawing method for the projectile features, a pulsing animation as well as drawing the projectile in the correct location.
      void move()
      I wanted the shot's movement to be unique, so I made it travel along a wave.

      • Projectile

        public Projectile(int xPos,
                  int yPos,
                  int size,
                  java.awt.Color c)
        This constructor uses the super constructor to initialize the object's data members.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x position of the projectile.
        yPos - The y position of the projectile.
        size - The size of the projectile.
        c - The color of the projectile.

    • Method Detail

      • drawObject

        public void drawObject(java.awt.Graphics pen)
        The unique drawing method for the projectile features, a pulsing animation as well as drawing the projectile in the correct location.
        Specified by:
        drawObject in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        pen - The graphics object to which is drawn.

      • move

        public void move()
        I wanted the shot's movement to be unique, so I made it travel along a wave. It also has a side effect of testing the collision detection in areas of the enemy ships that wouldn't normally be hit (ie the sides).
        Specified by:
        move in class GameObject
